caption: Figure 1
alt: This table outlines the role of the circulatory system in the other organ systems in the body.

caption: Figure 2
alt: This diagram shows the network of blood vessels in the lungs.

caption: Figure 3
alt: This diagrams shows the major arteries in the human body.

caption: Figure 4
alt: This diagram shows the aorta and the major parts are labeled.

caption: Figure 5
alt: This diagram shows the blood vessels in the head and brain.

caption: Figure 6
alt: This diagram shows the arteries of the brain.

caption: Figure 7
alt: This diagram shows the arteries in the thoracic and abdominal cavity.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 8
alt: This table shows the different arteries in the thoracic and abdominal cavity. The list on the left shows unpaired arteries, and the list on the right shows paired cavities.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 9
alt: This flowchart shows the different branches into which that the abdominal aorta is divided.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 10
alt: This diagram shows the arteries in the arm.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 11
alt: This chart shows the arteries present in the thoracic upper limb.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 12
alt: The left panel shows the anterior view of arteries in the legs, and the right panel shows the posterior view.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 13
alt: This chart shows the major arteries present in the lower limbs.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 14
alt: This diagram shows the major veins in the human body.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 15
alt: This diagram shows the veins present in the thoracic abdominal cavity.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 16
alt: This diagram shows the veins present in the head and neck.

caption: Figure 17
alt: This diagram shows the veins present in the upper limb.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 18
alt: This flowchart shows the different veins in the body, and how they are connected to the superior vena cava.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 19
alt: This chart shows the connection between the different veins and the inferior vena cava.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 20
alt: The left panel shows the anterior view of veins in the legs, and the right panel shows the posterior view.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 21
alt: This charts shows the veins in the lower limbs, and how they are connected.

caption: Figure 22
alt: This diagram shows the veins in the digestive system.
